dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model
Class Location

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.Location

public class Location
extends java.lang.Object

A Location supplies the location of one or multiple files and the content type of these files. If the content type is not explicitly provided, the Location class tries to auto detect it by parsing the file. Locations use URIs to reference model locations to be able to load models from files within jar files or crypto containers or to reference to multiple files.

Location objects are used by RCtxt to load or save model content.

Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

Since:
11

Constructor Detail

Location

public Location(java.lang.String uri)
         throws CtxtException
Create a Location from other resources than regular files like jar files, crypto containers or the net. The content type is automatically detected with a fall back to "xdm" if the content type cannot be detected. If the URI is a file: URI or files: URI on windows and the URI does not contain a drive name the drive name of the drive from which EB tresos Studio was started is prefixed to the path.

Parameters:
uri - The URI string that points to the model content
Throws:
CtxtException - if the uri is invalid (e.g. if it is a relative URI ../test.xdm)
Since:
11

Location

public Location(java.lang.String uri,
                java.lang.String type)
         throws CtxtException
Create a Location from other resources than regular files like jar files, crypto containers or the net. If the URI is a file: URI or files: URI on windows and the URI does not contain a drive name the drive name of the drive from which EB tresos Studio was started is prefixed to the path.

Parameters:
uri - The URI that points to the model content
type - the content type or null to auto detect the content type (may fall back to "xdm" if the content type cannot be detected)
Throws:
CtxtException - if the uri is invalid (e.g. if it is a relative URI ../test.xdm)
Since:
11

Parameters:
file - the file to load or save the model from or to
Throws:
CtxtException - if an absolute file location cannot be determined

Create a Location that references more than one file. The content type is automatically detected with a fall back to "xdm" if the content type cannot be detected.

Parameters:

Method Detail

getFile

public java.io.File getFile()
Get the referenced file if the Location points to a local file. If the Location points to multiple files the first one is returned.

Returns:
the referenced file or null if non is referenced
Since:
11

getFiles

public java.io.File[] getFiles()
Get the referenced files if the Location points local files.

Returns:
the referenced files or null if non are referenced
Since:
11

getType

public Location.Type getType()
Query the content type of the referenced persistent model. The content type is either provided via the constructor explicitly or auto detected from the referenced file content. If no content type is explicitly provided and it also cannot be auto detected a default of "xdm" is assumed.

Returns:
the content type (never null)
Since:
11

getUri

public java.lang.String getUri()
Query the uri representation of the Location.

Returns:
The URI
Since:
11
